intro: Biscutella gredensis, commonly known as the Gredens Valley bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats. Biscutella gredensis is a perennial herb that is often found in mountainous regions, where it thrives in sunny, well-drained conditions.
